meanings.definition: To seek the affection or love of someone.
meanings.sent1: He wooed her with flowers and sweet words.
meanings.sent2: The young man wooed the girl by writing her love letters.
meanings.sent3: The cat wooed the owner by purring and rubbing against their legs.
meanings.sent4: The sun wooed the flowers with its warm rays, coaxing them to bloom.
meanings.sent5: The knight wooed the princess with his chivalrous deeds and brave heart.

meanings.definition: To try to gain the favor of someone.
meanings.sent1: She wooed her boss by always completing tasks on time.
meanings.sent2: The politician wooed the voters with promises of positive change.
meanings.sent3: The dog wooed its owner by fetching the newspaper every morning.
meanings.sent4: The music wooed the audience, filling their hearts with joy.
meanings.sent5: The student wooed the teacher with thoughtful questions and hard work.

meanings.sent1: He wooed her by taking her out on romantic dates.
meanings.sent2: The couple wooed each other with love letters and sweet gestures.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel wooed its mate by offering the juiciest nuts.
meanings.sent4: The moon wooed the night sky, casting a soft glow over everything.
meanings.sent5: The prince wooed the princess with songs of love and devotion.
